intro: Pergularia celebica, commonly known as the Celebes periwinkle, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its succulent stems and leaves make it adaptable to various soil types, though it prefers well-drained conditions. Pergularia celebica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
